result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy C Denton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay court costs. **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence. 
_____________________________

No alcohol or illegal drugs to be consumed or possessed. Not to enter any bars or liquor stores. 
____________________________

Obtain SOT assessment.  Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.   Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
____________________________

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
____________________________

timeConds.notes: To commence on or before November 1, 2016 at 8:00am with Work Release privileges.

records.addlTxt: Pro Se Motion sent to Judge for response -Revocation/Huber
Motion and Order granting reinstatement of the defendant's work release privileges

Motion requesting reinstatement of work release privileges - GRANTED
**02/17/2017 - signed order faxed to jail
Pro se motion denied -  Revocation/Huber
Pro Se Motion sent to Judge for response - revocation/huber
Order on Petition for Revocation of Huber Privileges

10:30 am  Court in sesison.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
DA Zeke S. Wiedenfeld appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Jeremy C Denton in court, in custody.  
Also present in Court are Jail Supt. Steve Sax and Sgt. Duffy.  
This matter is on today at the defendant's request to have the Court review the decision to revoke the defendant's huber privileges after the Court was provided with information from the Sheriff's Office with regard to violations.  Court does not normally require testimony be taken unless requested.  Attorney Wiedenfeld makes offer of proof with regard to the violations and makes further record as to the defendant's history of other violations.  
10:33 am  Response by Mr. Denton.  
10:41 am  Response by Attorney Wiedenfeld.  
10:43 am  Further statement by Mr. Denton.  
10:44 am  Court makes record with regard to the defendant's Huber violations.  Court does not find Mr. Denton to be credible.  Court notes his huber privileges were revoked on December 1st.  Court will allow huber privileges to be reinstated on January 2nd but it will be up to the jail as to whether or not he will get electronic monitoring.  
10:48 am  Court in recess.
Hearing on December 9, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Petition and Order for Revocation of Huber Privileges
Temporary Commitment form filed

10:37 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
Spec. Pros. Zeke S. Wiedenfeld appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Jeremy C Denton in court with Atty Carol E Unger.  
Matter is before the court for sentencing hearing.  Court recites charges and maximum potential penalties.  
Per plea agreement, the State will advise Court of all relevant sentencing factors but will not make a specific recommendation as to sentence. Defense is free to argue.  
10:40 am  Jayne Sager is sworn and testifies on exam of Atty Unger-Keizer.  
10:47 am  Questions of Ms. Sager by Atty Wiedenfeld.  
10:51 am  Pastor Bruce Bruns is sworn and testifies on exam of Atty Unger-Keizer.  
10:54 am  Witness excused.  10:55 am  Statements to Court by Atty Wiedenfeld.  
11:04 am  Argument as to sentence by Attorney Unger-Keizer.  
11:14 am  Statement by Mr. Denton.  
11:17 am  Court proceeds with making its record and sentencing the defendant.  

On files 2015CF000330 and 2016CF000077:  
Withheld sentence - Three (3) years probation;  
Conditional Jail time on file 2015CF000330:  120 days in WCJ with work release privileges to commence on or before November 1st at 8:00 am.  
Three (3) days dead time credit IF REVOKED;  

1)  No alcohol or illegal drugs to be consumed or possessed.  
2)  Not to enter any bars or liquor stores.  
3)  Obtain AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.  
4)  Obtain SOT assessment.  
5)  Counseling as recommended.  
6)  Maintain full time employment.  
7)  Submit DNA sample, if not already provided, and pay surcharge.  
8)  Pay court costs and DOC supervision fees.  
9)  Reimburse buy money in the amount of $30.00 to the Walworth County Drug Enforcement Unit.  

Defendant cannot possess a firearm and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  
11:35 am  Court in recess.
Order For Defendant's Appearance at Department of Corrections for Pre-Sentence Investigation report.

Defendant Jeremy C Denton in court with attorney Carol E Unger.  Andrew R. Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Bond Reinstated.  Minutes filed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2016 at 10:00 am.

2:30 PM Final Pretrial Calendar:  Atty Carol Keizer appears on behalf of Jeremy Denton who is not present in Court.  State has made an offer in this case.  Atty Keizer last spoke with Mr. Denton a week and a half ago and does not know why he is not present today.  Court orders a warrant and bail forfeiture.
